alert.note: Alert for Fountain; Parke; Vermillion; Warren (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 09 at 9:45PM EST until March 14 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Indiana... Illinois... Wabash River .Ongoing flooding will continue along portions of the East Fork White, White, and Wabash Rivers and their tributaries. River stages are rising again due to previous rainfall over the weekend. Minor flooding is largely expected, which primarily impacts river roads, parks, and agricultural land. The crest on the Wabash River is between Lafayette and Covington. The crest on the White River is near Spencer. The crest on the East Fork White River is between Seymour and Rivervale. New precipitation amounts through the weekend will not impact current flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Covington. * WHEN...Until early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, A few county roads begin to flood. Higher bottomlands begin to flood. The first cottage upstream from U.S. 136 bridge may become isolated by high water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:45 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 19.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:45 PM EST Wednesday was 19.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.7 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Thursday morning by around 1100 AM EST /1000 AM CST/.
